name: Reina's economy attack
description:
The idea is to run a classic anarch suite with Grimoire, Datasuckers and Parasites, clone chips for reccurance, with 2 rooks and running interference to make key runs super costly for the corp

You could probably replace nerve agent and medium with keyhole so the deck willl be more resilient to purges

Haven't tested it yet, maybe memory is a bit tight, or maybe ti falls apart right off the but.

name: Beginner Deck
Beginner Deck
Paparazzi v4
description:
Typical Fast Advance, but with a little more money for some bigger ICE.

It relies heavily on getting a rezzed SanSan, but I've never had trouble doing that, even against Reina. The MVP of the deck is certainly Shipment from SanSan. Saving two credits may not seem like a lot, but it can be the difference between life and death. Once one Autoscript is scored, the game is pretty much over. I originally had two GLCs instead of two Rototurrets; however, the two subroutines really helped slow down the runner as well as kill some pesky data suckers. I got 6th in the Taipei Tournament with the first variant of this deck; however, I switched to the second identity and took out the tracing ICE to speed the deck up. In my Shaper heavy meta, this deck usually scores too quickly for them to stop me. The two decks that give me trouble are CTFaerush and Reina. Both of these match ups though prove less troublesome once I get DataRaven in front of HQ. The tags feed the Closed Accounts and provides a small enough window to score with SfSS.

name: Jalapeño Face
description:
Very slight changes from my last version. I'm basically certain card draw to open up options is the most important thing for Gabe. To this end, Mr. Li is a triplicate. He is essential to the gameplan, and works against the weakness of running 3 of himself.

You essentially have to win early or you'll run out of steam, due to the lower economy, particularly if you get shut out of HQ. I'm wondering what to slot to improve staying power for when R&D won't cough up agendas (though keyhole should REALLY handle this...).

Kati Jones as a 1-2 of??? In place of what??

name: Simple Gabe
description: This deck is designed to provide simple, straightforward gameplay. I made this deck for teaching friends about netrunner. It does use some newer cards (Lawyer Up) because I think it allows for simpler use of account siphon.

name: Weyland : a High-Teak, Environment-Friendly Company
description:
Welcome to our cyber-tour of our Amazon Complex! Here, at Weyland Amazon HQ, we design and test the latest generation of upgradable cyberdefenses. Our suite of 'pay what you want' protection has proven extremely efficient to repel any kind of intrusions (see our demonstration against hacking attempts: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F***_4CC0UNT_5IPH0N). All our products come with a free trial period of three months. In case they do not fully satisfy you, we will give you a refund of up to 50% on the initial price (see[1]). Last but foremost, we provide an optional service for our best clients of remote and secured research centers. Please download our brochure for more information.

[1]: all customer service is subcontracted to our associates, Jinteki, for their nipponese 'Human Touch'.

For internship opportunities, please contact us at budget_savings@weyland.com

[Full Disclosure: this deck has not been tested. I do not play enough for my taste at the moment :( The idea is to put an Amazon on HQ and stack ICE like a madman (hence, the interns). I thought it would go well with Off the grid. Scorched Earth x2 is there to keep the runner honest around tags&traces.]

name: Anarch Suite andromeda

name: HB - Profiteering Fast Advance
description:
The deck has the shell of a Fast Advance deck, but it uses Profiteering to gain 15 credits, that is enough to Biotic Labor/Sansan out 2 more Agendas.

Labor costs (-4) credits, HB identity gives you (+1) for installing Agenda, Advancing Agendas cost (-3). If you start the turn with 6 credits you can labor out Profiteering giving you 15 credits. You can then Labor/Sansan out more Agendas from hand.

You probably should only have 3 Bad Pub in total, anything more might start to hurt. Depending on how much credits you have can you choose not to get a Bad Pub from Profiteering or any of the other modes.

[Updated]
